Now that marijuana is legal in several parts of the U.S., researchers are starting to debunk several [myths about marijuana](https://www.muscleandfitness.com/features/edge/what-are-long-term-consequences-weed/). At the same time, weed's social stigma is beginning to loosen—so much so, in fact, that athletes and fitness gurus who laud [weed's wellness benefits](https://www.muscleandfitness.com/features/edge/cbd-no-longer-banned-athletic-competition-heres-what-means-you/) are starting to challenge the stereotype of lazy, overweight stoners. But is [cannabis truly a miracle drug](https://www.muscleandfitness.com/features/edge/what-every-guy-should-know-about-thc-and-cbd-weed/) that enhances athletic performance or do its negative side effects outweigh its benefits?
